pgTitle: List of United States servicemembers and civilians missing in action during the Vietnam War (1961–65)

rows.text: Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B apparently shot down by Chinese Mig-17 fighters.
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D failed to pull up after a bombing run, hit the ground and exploded.
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-8D was damaged by anti-aircraft fire and crashed into the sea, no ejection or parachute was observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D crashed, no ejection or parachute observed
Merchant seaman from the SS Audry J. Luchenback, a civilian freighter anchored in the Da Nang port, last seen at the Pacific Bar, Bạch Đằng Street, Da Nang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an O-1F Bird Dog that disappeared near Camp Holloway
Killed in action, body not recovered
Adviser to the ARVN, captured by Vietcong in an ambush. Died of disease/malnutrition on 4 February 1966
Died in captivity, remains not returned
His F-8 was hit by ground fire and crashed, no ejection or parachute observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
His RF-8A was shot down while conducting a low-altitude bomb damage assessment mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Electronic sensor operator on OV-1C #61-2687 shot down over the U Minh Forest
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1B #63-038557 that crashed under heavy fire while making an emergency troop insertion into the area of the Đồng Xoài Special Forces Camp
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1B #63-038557 that crashed under heavy fire while making an emergency troop insertion into the area of the Đồng Xoài Special Forces Camp
Killed in action, body not recovered
Survived crash of UH-1B #63-038557 and radioed that all others aboard had been killed and subsequently disappeared in the battle
Passenger on UH-1B #63-08557 that crashed under heavy fire while making an emergency troop insertion into the area of the Đồng Xoài Special Forces Camp, he survived the crash but was shot by Vietcong
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of UH-1B #63-038557 that crashed under heavy fire while making an emergency troop insertion into the area of the Đồng Xoài Special Forces Camp
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-100D was hit by ground fire and he ejected safely, a search and rescue helicopter observed his body being dragged from his landing site
Killed in action, body not recovered
He was serving as advisor to the Cai Be District Chief, when captured by the Vietcong
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman aboard a B-52F that collided with another B-52
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman aboard a B-52F that collided with another B-52
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of a B-52F that collided with another B-52
Killed in action, body not recovered
Gunner aboard a B-52F that collided with another B-52
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman aboard a B-52F that collided with another B-52
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman aboard a B-52F that collided with another B-52
Killed in action, body not recovered
His unit came under attack, he was wounded and separated from his unit. His body was not recovered due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on a C-123B that crashed on a classified night mission with 14 Chinese troops on board
Killed in action, body not recovered
His RF-101C #0040 was hit by anti-aircraft fire, he apparently ejected and was killed on the ground
Captured when the Vietcong overran the Ba Gia outpost. Died of injuries on 17 September 1967
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Disappeared while hiking near Chu Lai Air Base, believed killed by Vietcong
Killed in action, body not recovered

Adviser Team 2, an 8-man South Vietnamese Special Forces long range reconnaissance patrol ambushed while gathering intelligence near Highway 19, he was last seen alive with Master Sergeant Gallant being pursued by enemy forces
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-8E failed to pull up from a strafing run and impacted the ground, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D was hit by enemy fire and he ejected but hit the sea at high speed and was believed to have died on impact
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

His RF-101C #56-0186 was hit by enemy fire, he successfully ejected and radioed that he was on the ground without serious injury. When the search and rescue helicopter approached the area they were unable to make radio contact with him
Weapons Systems Operator on F-4C #63-7700 shot down during a low-altitude strafing run, the aircraft crashed and exploded. No parachutes observed
Passenger in an A-1G that crashed, no ejection or parachutes observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an A-1G that crashed, no ejection or parachutes observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-1H #139693 was hit by antiaircraft fire while attacking supply barges on the Song Gia Hoi River and crashed, no ejection or parachute observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
His RF-8A #146826 crashed into the sea 5 miles east of Quang Khe
His F-8E was hit by anti-aircraft fire over Thanh Hóa Province and crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4E was hit by anti-aircraft fire, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D #62-4247, was hit by anti-aircraft fire while attacking a barracks east of Na San, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an A-6A #151588 that crashed into the sea while attacking North Vietnamese Navy torpedo boats
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D call sign Elm 2 hit the ground during a rocket attack, no ejection observed
Died in captivity, remains not returned
His F-8E crashed into the sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of an F-4C #63-7712 hit by anti-aircraft fire, one parachute observed. The remains of the pilot Captain Charles J Scharf were identified in 2006
His F-105D was hit by anti-aircraft fire
Pilot of an F-4B hit by anti-aircraft fire during an attack on the Thái Nguyên bridge, observed to have ejected from the aircraft
Pilot of an F-4B hit by anti-aircraft fire, no ejection or parachutes observed. The radar intercept officer, LTJG Porter A. Halyburton did eject, was captured and released in Operation Homecoming
His A-4C disappeared on a ground attack mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on an RB-66B #53-0452 that crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on an RB-66B #53-0452 that crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Captured by Vietcong while travelling on Route 15 from Vũng Tàu to Saigon, attempted escape on 2 November and last seen alive on that date
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Captured by Vietcong while travelling on Route 15 from Vũng Tàu to Saigon, attempted escape on 2 November and last seen alive on that date
Died in captivity, remains not returned
His F-105D #61-0163 flew into the ground on a bombing run, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-1E #52-132898 was hit by ground fire and crashed near LZ X-Ray, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
He was reported to have been shot several times and killed but his body could not be located
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on a UH-34D #147180 that crashed at sea in bad weather
Copilot of a UH-34D that crashed at sea in bad weather
Crewman on a UH-34D that crashed at sea in bad weather
Pilot of a UH-34D that crashed at sea in bad weather
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of a UH-34D #148762 transporting ARVN troops when it was hit by a mortar round, caught fire and crashed killing all 4 crewmmen and the 9 ARVN onboard
Killed in action, body not recovered
Shot and killed in a Vietcong ambush, body unable to be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Shot and killed in a Vietcong ambush, body unable to be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Gunner on a UH-34D hit by ground fire, crashed into the sea and sank
Killed in action, body not recovered
His O-1D suffered engine failure and crash-landed in shallow water near Qui Nhơn, search and rescue teams were unable to locate him and his rescue gear
His A-4C crashed while landing on the USS Kitty Hawk
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system officer on an F-4C #64‑0678 that was hit by enemy fire. The pilot Captain Robert Jeffrey ejected, was captured and released in Operation Homecoming
Pilot of an RA-5C hit by an SA-2 missile. The navigator, LTJG Glenn H Daigle successfully ejected, was captured and released in Operation Homecoming
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4C was hit by enemy fire and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered

Merchant Marine seaman aboard the ship SS Express Baltimore, he and the second officer, Stephen O'Laughlin went ashore in Qui Nhơn and disappeared. In June 1973 remains later identified as those of Stephen O'Laughlin were recovered from a grave in Phú Yên Province
Radar intercept officer on an F-4B #151412 that was hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #151412 that was hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
